summary.span: 表示托管 对象，该对象的设计旨在与 Oracle 数据类型配合使用。

span.span: Represents a managed object designed to work with the Oracle data type.

summary.span: 此类不能被继承。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Oracle `BFILE` 数据类型是一种 oracle `LOB` 数据类型，包含对二进制数据的引用，其最大大小为 4 gb。The Oracle `BFILE` data type is an Oracle `LOB` data type that contains a reference to binary data with a maximum size of 4 gigabytes. Oracle `BFILE` 与其他 oracle 数据类型的不同之处在于 `LOB` ，它的数据存储在操作系统而不是服务器上的物理文件中。An Oracle `BFILE` differs from other Oracle `LOB` data types in that its data is stored in a physical file in the operating system instead of on the server. 请注意， `BFILE` 数据类型提供对数据的只读访问。Note that the `BFILE` data type provides read-only access to data. 因此，不支持从类继承的面向编写的方法 。Therefore, write-oriented methods inherited from the class are not supported. 数据类型的其他特征与 `BFILE` `LOB` 数据类型区分开来是：Other characteristics of a `BFILE` data type that distinguish it from a `LOB` data type are that it: - 包含非结构化数据。Contains unstructured data. - 支持服务器端分块。Supports server-side chunking. - 使用引用复制语义。Uses reference copy semantics. 例如，如果在上执行复制操作 `BFILE` ，则只会 `BFILE` 复制定位符 (该文件) 的引用。For example, if you perform a copy operation on a `BFILE`, only the `BFILE` locator (which is a reference to the file) is copied. 而不会复制文件中的数据。The data in the file is not copied. `BFILE`数据类型应用于引用 `LOB` 大小较大的，因此，在数据库中存储不切合实际。The `BFILE` data type should be used for referencing `LOB`s that are large in size, and therefore, not practical to store in the database. `BFILE`与数据类型相比，使用数据类型存在客户端、服务器和通信开销 `LOB` 。There is client, server, and communication overhead for using a `BFILE` data type compared to the `LOB` data type. `BFILE`如果只需要获取少量的数据，则访问更有效。It is more efficient to access a `BFILE` if you only need to obtain a small amount of data. 如果需要获取整个对象，则可以更高效地访问数据库驻留 `LOB` 。It is more efficient to access database-resident `LOB`s if you need to obtain the entire object. 每个非 NULL 对象都与定义基础物理文件位置的两个实体相关联：Each non-NULL object is associated with two entities that define the location of the underlying physical file: - 一个 Oracle DIRECTORY 对象，它是文件系统中一个目录的数据库别名，以及An Oracle DIRECTORY object, which is a database alias for a directory in the file system, and - 基础物理文件的文件名，它位于与 DIRECTORY 对象关联的目录中。The file name of the underlying physical file, which is located in the directory associated with the DIRECTORY object. 创建后 `BFILE` ，可以 使用或方法检索对象的形式的定位符 。After a `BFILE` is created, you can retrieve its locator in the form of an object using the or methods. 若要获取 对象，请调用 方法。To obtain an object, call the method. 与对象关联的物理文件在 您尝试访问它之前无需存在。The physical file that an object is associated with does not need to exist until you attempt to access it. 应用程序可以将绑定 到不存在的文件，在预期位置创建物理文件，然后调用 。An application can bind an to a nonexistent file, create the physical file in the expected location, and then call . 使用或方法访问已关闭的任何尝试 都会自动重新打开流。Any attempt to access a closed using the or methods reopens an stream automatically. 下面的 c # 示例演示如何 `BFILE` 在 Oracle 表中创建，然后以对象的形式检索它 。The following C# example demonstrates how you can create a `BFILE` in an Oracle table, and then retrieve it in the form of an object. 该示例演示如何使用 对象以及 和 方法。The example demonstrates the use of the object and the and methods. [!code-csharp[DataWorks OracleClient.BFile#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/DataWorks OracleClient.BFile/CS/source.cs#1)] 有关创建和使用 Oracle 的详细信息 `BFILE` ，请参阅 oracle 文档中的相应主题。For more information about creating and using an Oracle `BFILE`, see the appropriate topic in your Oracle documentation. > [!NOTE] > `BeginWrite` `EndWrite` `WriteByte` `System.IO.Stream` 由于 `BFILE` 数据类型是只读的，因此不支持从类继承的、和方法。The `BeginWrite`, `EndWrite`, and `WriteByte` methods, which are inherited from the `System.IO.Stream` class, are not supported because the `BFILE` data type is read-only.

summary.span: 创建此 对象的副本，该副本所关联的物理文件与原始对象所关联的相同。

span.span: Creates a copy of this object associated with the same physical file as the original.

returns.span: 一个新 对象，该对象所关联的物理文件与原始 对象所关联的相同。

span.span: A new object associated with the same physical file as the original object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 新对象的属性 最初具有与原始对象相同的值。The properties of the new object initially have the same values as those of the original object. 但是，在 完成后，每个 对象都相互独立。However, after the is complete, each object is independent from the other. 例如，更改原始属性的值不 会更改副本上的的值 。For example, changing the value of the property on the original does not change the value of on the copy.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 源和目标的基础数据类型 必须兼容。The underlying data types of the source and the destination must be compatible. 例如，不能将二进制数据复制到 具有字符数据类型的目标。For example, you cannot copy binary data to a destination that has a character data type. 您必须对目标具有写入访问权限， 操作才能正确执行。You must have write access to the destination for the operation to execute correctly.

summary.span: 表示空 对象，该对象没有绑定到物理文件。

span.span: Represents a null object that is not bound to a physical file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果要对执行比较操作 以确定为空性，则会很有用。 can be useful when you want to perform a comparison operation on an to determine nullability. 对对象执行读取操作的任何尝试都会 成功，但不会返回任何数据。Any attempt to perform a read operation on a object succeeds, but does not return any data. 对对象执行写操作的任何尝试 都会生成异常。Any attempt to perform a write operation on a object generates an exception. 选择 `BFILE` 包含 null 值的列时，将 返回。Selecting a `BFILE` column that contains a null value returns .

summary.span: 获取 流中的当前读取位置。

span.span: Gets the current read position in the stream.
The current position within the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不支持查找超出流长度的任何位置。Seeking to any location beyond the length of the stream is not supported. `Position`属性不跟踪流中已使用的、跳过的或两个字节的字节数。The `Position` property does not keep track of the number of bytes from the stream that have been consumed, skipped, or both.

exception.span: 尝试用一个负值或大于该流长度的值设置位置。

exception.span: 关闭或释放该流后，调用方法。

span.span: Methods were called after the stream was closed or disposed.

summary.span: 获取 类型的 （它包含 数据）。

span.span: Gets an of type that contains the data.

value.span: 类型的 （它包含 数据）。

span.span: An of type that contains the data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性一次读取整个 `BFILE` 。The property reads the entire `BFILE` at one time. > [!NOTE] > 使用的好处是能够在 `BFILE` 客户端上检索大量数据。A benefit of using `BFILE`s is the ability to retrieve large amounts of data in chunks at the client. 但是，当你使用时 ，你将获取用于 BFILE 列的所有数据，作为一个连续块区，这可能会显著增加应用程序开销。However, when you use , you obtain all the data for the BFILE column as one contiguous chunk, which can significantly increase application overhead.
